item.title: Dplyr’s select - tips and tricks
item.description: It’s not the most interesting function, or even that much fun. But dplyr’s select has a lot of functionality that is often overlooked. All select does is ‘select’ columns, yet understanding some of its functionality deeper than surface level saves me a bunch of time in my day-to-day work. Let’s take a tour of where dplyr::select can save you time too, by calling out situations where I find myself using the function over and over again.
